text:

The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders(DSM) is not about diagnosing every aspect of Human Neurodiversity, it‚Äôs about clinical diagnosis.

If you start shitting on neurodiversity or people's struggles in neurodiversity, we are done.

There's no extra credit for a "bootstraps" mentality or overextending yourself.

text:
@StrivingAutist There are various issues with the diagnosis process. 

By design and intention the DSM does not concern itself with *sub-clinical* aspects of Neurodiversity. 

It is explicitly focused on what it considers *mental disorders* 

Your statement is referencing other issues.

text:
It feels like every day I find yet another part of myself that's a 'common neurodiversity sign' and it's just like, *how* much of who and what I am is signed by ND?

How much better would I know myself and how much better would I *accept* myself if I'd known this decades ago?

text:

I have been working more closely nowadays with psychology, disability studies, and neurodiversity. So, I rarely get to use most of my education in biology.

text:
A new equality jargon just used on a zoom:
Neurodiversity: the range of differences in individual brain function & behavioural traits, regarded as part of normal variation in the human pop' (used especially in the context of autistic spectrum disorders, & bipolar disorders, etc.)

What is #Neurodiversity? üí≠
#Neurodiversity, #Neurodivergence, or #Neurovariance, are broad terms used to describe the variations in the human brain and cognition.

2018 was realising I was burnt out.

2019 was the toughest year we had ever had as a family. For lots of reasons I can't really ever talk about.

Then covid 2020. And covid 2021.

And multiple diagnoses of neurodiversity in the family (just in us and our five kids).

text:
@zerofox_ Yeah, A lot of neurodiversity overlaps, I have a boat load of childhood trauma but my 'issues' started before then.
It can be misdiagnosed, but they can also mistake ADHD for things like BPD. It's only after a psychological evaluation that you know for definite.

text:
@SarabjeetKaley @ramzanamin @SangitaMyska @LBC .

Neurodiversity is the concept that there are many brain types, all of which are normal.

text:
A genuinely hard question in Neurodiversity/Mad Pride:

If your mental illness can be shown to be caused by trauma, is it okay for people to encourage you to heal the trauma?

Or ought people respect where you are and not assume healing is a task you can or want to do?

@psychgeist52 @KieranRose7 The term Neurodiversity describes how an individual's neurological processing diverges from a median within a given population.
This is different from 'merely' introjected ways of thinking.
To use a computer analogy, it's like the difference between software and hardware.

text:
A DYSLEXIA diagnosis comes with advice.
Much of it is aimed at your wallet.

text: @GymRobcom @YessicaYesOrNo @lovingness333 @Theholisticpsyc Yes. Neurodiversity = brains are all different. Neurodivergent = specific set of brains that do not fit expectations. A single person can be neurodivergent, but can't be neurodiverse. A group can be neurodiverse, but is only neurodivergent if all members are neurodivergent.
